text:
This is a really cute little shop that sells products made with edible flowers - like salts, sugars, tea mixes, chai, and lots more. I just happened to stop in. The owner was really sweet and was putting out fresh cucumbers to sample the salts just as I arrived.

I had an iced chai with almond milk. I have to say, it was a bit weak and I couldn't taste the rose petals. But it was refreshing nonetheless!

This place has an excellent selection of teas and spices. The freshly baked cookies are very reasonably priced.

Overall, this place is so cute and perfect that it could be a live action version of a shop from a Studio Ghibli movie. Bonus: the dog and cats that lounge during the day.

best coffee, cakes, cute things, and this comes fom a proclaimed badass. this place is warm and inviting and cozy and smells so good and the staff/owner were so happy and warm. buy a new book, go here and grab a coffee and sit on the comfy old couch and greatly waste an afternoon.

It's very cute and I enjoyed the food I had here. My main problem is that their website is completely inaccurate even though parts of it are updated daily, so I doubt it's a matter of simple oversights.
*On their website they claim to have a special for about $10 that includes the meal of the day, drink and dessert but apparently they haven't had this for a long time. You'll probably spend closer to $15 for the three. 
*Their hours are also inaccurate: I came in at about 5:45 only to be told they were closing at 6 despite the site saying 9. On the plus side they did let my friend and I sit and did not rush us along at all. 
*The meals do not all contain flower elements as advertised but the desserts and drinks are pretty good about this. Almost none of the food is actually topped with flowers.
*They do have disposable containers for takeout.

Overall I would definitely go back and recommend it to others, but I really wish they would represent themselves more accurately online.

Had a lovely soup and salad here, very minimal but good options, lovely interior. For some reason I really didn't grasp the smallness of the place from the previous review. There are a few spots at the window and a couch with coffee table as well. Probably a total of 6 people could eat here at once. Still recommend. Especially loved that they gave us our takeout in a mason jar with a 'please bring this back'.

Accidentally walked by one afternoon and had to pop in. The spot is so quaint and pretty. I didn't eat here, but ordered a lavender lemonade (they were served in glass mason jars) and sat by the couch and table for a chat w/a friend. They have lots of cute products for purchase, all made with flowers - salts, cookie mixes, sugars. This would be a great spot to have an afternoon catch-up with a girlfriend.

Oh quelle découverte! Je passais souvent devant (habitant dans le quartier auparavant), sans jamais avoir pris le temps de m'y arrêter. C'est fou ce qu'on peut louper en marchant sur le trottoir sans jamais s'arrêter. Cette fois-ci, j'y ai fait une halte par recommandation et sans regret!
Quelle idée fantastique que la vente de fleurs comestibles, des fleurs pour parfumer un café, un latté, du sucre avec différentes saveurs de fleurs, des produits cosmétiques également concoctés maison... 
Ils ont d'ailleurs des fleurs qui poussent sur le toit de l'édifice où se trouve ce petit commerce. Oui je dis "petit" commerce, car c'est vraiment tout petit, mais avec tellement de cachet. Par contre, ne venez pas en gang de 10, ça ne passera pas.
L'employée m'a signifié qu'ils faisaient à manger tous les midis. Ce midi c'était un poulet au curry. Ce que je tenterais prochainement: leur brunch les WE! Cela m'a l'air bien intéressant gustativement parlant!
Pour ma part, j'ai cédé aux fleurs comestibles qui décorent très joliment et de manière très originale un plat (photo à l'appui). J'ai obté pour les géraniums de couleur rose pétard!
Un dernier élément sur lequel j'ai craqué?! Un élément qui n'est pas à vendre ....... leur chat du nom de Shirley! Se délassant sur le canapé de la place, la présence de personnes étrangères n'avait pas bien l'air de le déranger dans sa sieste. Même en appliquant une caresse, je n'ai pas eu l'impression de le perturber dans son état de bien-être total. Sa présence procure une sensation encore plus cosy, un sentiment d'être à la maison...

Where to start? This is an oasis of calm in the heart on Montreal. Original flooring and shelves from when this space was a general store, it sells awesome salts, sugars, hot chocolate, spice mixes, teas and cookie mixes - all using edible flowers. I particularly love the jasmine and violet hot chocolates. They also have an espresso machine and make some awesome coffee, tea and (in the summer) lemonades with flower essences. They also do great baked goods (I have given the cookies as gifts a few times), soups and salads and I just had my birthday brunch there yesterday! 
The owner-operator is not only friendly but knowledgable! You can tell she has a passion for what she does. 
Oh and they have free wifi!
You can't miss!

Magasin d'épices sucre etc avec une décoration tout en bois?

Je tombe sous le charme direct. 
La boutique est petite juste 2 petites tables si l'on veut prendre de quoi sur place. La présentation des produits est vraiment sympa.

La vendeuse accueillante m'a tout de suite demandé si j'avais des questions.

J'ai fais un petit tour, je suis tombé sur une bonne variété de sel gris (sel non traiter) aromatisés, de fleur de sel, de sucre aromatisés (choco-jasmin, choco-violette, etc).

Mais j'y suis allez à la base car j'ai vu sur leur page facebook qu'il y avait du lait d'avoine en quantité limité et j'étais curieux d'y goûter (et c'est vraiment bon). Vendu dans des pots mason de 1 litre.

Avec ça je me suis aussi acheté du sucre choco-jasmin, du sel romarin-lavande et un mélange d'épice.

Le sucre est vraiment bon aussi (testé dans un milk-shake banane).

J'y retournerai pour des petits plaisirs, ou même pour acheter un cadeau de fete etc à des amis aimant la cuisine =).

Well, I have to say I liked this place better when there was enough seating, even though  it's the size of a postage stamp. Trouble is, they advertise themselves as a grocery store, therefore; they are actually NOT allowed to set themselves up as a tea room/resto. They were caught by a Ville de Montréal inspector who informed them they could not  have tables & serve food as a restaurant,  since they're officially a grocery store.  Consecquently, they removed  the few tables they had and placed an old sofa , 2 tiny tables, and 1 counter to serve as seating. Most times when I came by for some of their excellent tea & treats, I had to leave as the place was PACKED!.  Luckily, last week,  I was able to secure a spot on the sofa, then moved to  1 of the 2 tables which was vacated a bit later. I had their rose/cardamon tea, which was just super especially on a cold rainy day.Their lavander/chocolate brownie tasted somewhat odd, somehow, the 2 tastes didn't seem to blend well. Their cookies are 3 for $2.00, and very good, as I recall.  The cost of the tea was $ 3.00,  a bit on the high side, but they'll  gladly refill your pot wirh hot water if you ask ( the tea is loose & strong so it'll still be ok )  and the brownie was $ $4.00.  Totl cost w/tx almot $8.00.... kind of high. Wanted to buy some of the tea to take home, but the TINY package was $9.00!!!! I needless to say, passed. Overall I have to say though, as a once in awhile treat, it's  just fine, especially if you're a tea lover.

Adorable. L'espace, minuscule, est tout juste assez grand pour le flux de clients, constant mais sans jamais se sentir coincé. Les produits sont originaux et abordables, surtout quand on prend en compte leur qualité. Je n'ai pas pu m'empêcher d'acheter toute sortes de sucres; à la rose, à la violette, sucre de cacao au jasmin, je me suis aussi laissée tenter par du granola coco jasmin (totalement divin sur mon yogurt grec ce matin) et une brume rose et coco pour les cheveux. La vendeuse était tellement mignonne et dévouée, quand je lui ai dit que c'était ma première visite elle m'a conseillé le London fog à la rose, safran et cardamome et a fait le tour des produits avec moi, en m'expliquant leur différentes utilités. Le breuvage était divin, sucré juste comme il le faut, et j'ai également eu la chance de goûter à une soupe aux lentilles, riz sauvage et pomme grenade, délicieuse, ainsi qu'à de tendres biscuits au beurre rose et pistache tout juste sorti du four - ça fondait en bouche! Je ne risque pas d'être à court de sucre pour un moment, mais je risque de revenir vite si j'ai envie de me gater avec de bons petits plats!

Great little lunch/brunch spot on Duluth- they have one dish every day, and it is lovely and delicious and not very expensive.  Fresh, tasty homecooked food for those days when you just can't handle the idea of making something yourself.  Bring a tupperware for "to go" or so I hear.

The only complaint I can think of to lodge against Epicerie Fleur is that every single time I have stopped in here, they seem to be playing the same set of songs on loop. As advice to the owner, change up your playlist a bit!

Amazing, charming, quirky tea house in the center of Plateau Montreal.  We stopped in for some tea and noticed they have brunch on Sundays, so we came back the next day, and were so glad we did!  Friendly service, including a friendly cat, and delicious brunch, including a nice salad and some potatoes and eggs, and a cupcake to finish.  The best tea was the cedar rose.  There were only three tables, so if you want to eat, get there early.  We'll be back next time we're in town!
